author: Staff Reporter
text:
The opposition Congress has charged the ruling AINRC Government with adopting discriminatory approach in implementation of various welfare schemes.

Constituenceis ignored

Talking to reporters here on Thursday, Puducherry Pradesh Congress Committee president A. Namassivayam said that constituencies held by the Congress were ignored totally. They were totally kept out of the schemes for months together while in other constituencies the scheme was being implemented at a fast pace.

Mr. Namassivayam said that the distribution of free mixies and grinders was yet to reach cardholders in Kamaraj Nagar and Villianur held by the Congress.

The government owned undertakings were ignored and no steps were taken to salvage the situation while the administration was facilitating backdoor appointments increasing the debt burden, he said.

Felicitation function

The Congress will organise a felicitation function on February 12 here to honour party MLA E. Valsaraj representing Mahe, an enclave of the Union Territory in Kerala who has completed 25 years in the Assembly.

Leader of Opposition in the Rajya Sabha Ghulam Nabi Azad will be the chief guest at the function. Mr. Valsaraj was first elected from Mahe constituency in 1990 and was a Minister during the previous Congress regime.
title: AINRC under fire for ‘discriminatory approach’
